definition[0]: a statement in which you admit that something is true or that you have done something wrong
example[0]: Reese, by his own admission, lacks the necessary experience.
example[1]: Silence is often interpreted as an admission of guilt.
example[2]: The Senatorâ€™s admission that he had lied to Congress shocked many Americans.
definition[1]: permission given to someone to enter a building or place, or to become a member of a school, club etc
example[4]: The young men tried to enter a nightclub but were refused admission.
example[5]: Women gained admission to the club only recently.
example[6]: those applying for admission to university
definition[2]: the process of taking someone into a hospital for treatment, tests, or care
example[7]: There are 13,000 hospital admissions annually due to playground accidents.
definition[3]: the cost of entrance to a concert, sports event, cinema etc
example[9]: The cost includes free admission to the casinos.
example[10]: The Museum has no admission charge.
definition[4]: the cost of entrance to a cinema, sports event etc
example[11]: Museum admission prices are $10 for adults and $4 for children.
definition[5]: permission given to someone to enter a place, or become a member of a group, organization, school etc
example[12]: Many applicants are unable to gain admission to courses leading to these qualifications.
example[13]: Poland was granted full admission to the EU on the 1st May 2004.
definition[6]: permission given by a stockmarket to a company for its shares to be bought and sold there
example[14]: the admission of securities to official Stock Exchange listing
